reviewText: Great shows, but the DVD quality is not the best - I know that a lot of it is the rarity of the kinescopes and films of these sort of shows, but some of the episodes here seem to be multi-generational copies of old VHS tapes. Kent Taylor's great in the title role in any event - right up there with Chester Morris and Gerald Mohr.
The quality of the picture was not good.
the quality of this dvd is horrible.
Remember watching Kent Taylor in the 50's and this has re-kindeled those memories
Entertaining 1950s television program.
They don't  make them like this anymore.. Good old days relived
VERY GOOD

I just got through watching this last night.  The video quality was horrible.  It looked like either a copy of a copy of a copy, or else someone copied this off the TV and put it on a DVD.  There was no remastering, digitizing, or in any way enhancing the video.  Why can I get such a clear, sharp video of the Thin Man, which came earlier, but get such junk as this which is not as old as The Thin Man, or other older videos I have.  Amazon should have noted that the video had never been enhanced.

Save you money.  Do NOT buy this video.
very good if you like older shows

The quality of the picture isn't great, but it's good and watchable. The shots of the streets circa 1951 are a genuine treasure. Also, it's fun to see young Lee van Cleef under a pound of aging makeup.
Excellent service. Great product.
This is a series that duplicates the stories made famous in the movies.  It is very interesting.  The movie ones are a little better but all are entertaining.
Great for old time TV buffs
My husband was looking for Boston Blackie movies.  This was a collection of TV shows, but he enjoyed them.

THE VIDEO IS A JUNK MOVIE,  WOULD NOT PLAY; STOPS; PICTURE IS WORST COPY OF AND FILM I HAVE EVER SEEN  NOT WORTH THE COST NO MATTER HOW CHEAP.  LUCKY TO GET A STAR; ONLY BECAUSE OF WHAT IT WAS MEANT TO BE.
Poor video quality with all the limitations of live production.
A pretty good mix.
I loved them
I like it
Love Boston Blackie

I like the storylines but the quality of the picture and sound is terrible. If you close your eyes and listen to the dialog like you're listening to a radio show it's okay, but just okay. TV has come a long way since Boston Blacklist, Sky King and Decoy, Dragnet and Highway Patrol. Too had they couldn't take the time and energy to put out a quality show.
GOOD

I goofed on these as they are twenty-four minute, black and white television with amateurville production values.  The plots were light years ahead of "Colonel March of Scotland Yard" but that's about all the good there is.
Good old time drama.
